text: An election is coming. Universal peace is declared, and the foxes have a sincere interest in prolonging the lives of the poultry.
author: George Eliot

text: You can't make war in the Middle East without Egypt and you can't make peace without Syria.
author: Henry A. Kissinger

text: You may either win your peace or buy it: win it, by resistance to evil buy it, by compromise with evil.
author: John Ruskin

text: War may sometimes be a necessary evil. But no matter how necessary, it is always an evil, never a good. We will not learn how to live together in peace by killing each other's children.
author: Jimmy Carter

text: Fill you mind with the meaningless stimuli of a world preoccupied with meaningless things, and it will not be easy to feel peace in your heart.
author: Marianne Williamson
